intro: Sirmuellera ilicifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sirmuellera, is a shrub native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Sirmuellera ilicifolia is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions.
